org.letras.ps.rawdata
Interface IPenAdapterFactory

All Known Implementing Classes:
GenericPenAdapterFactory
public interface IPenAdapterFactory

A pen adapter factory allows creation of a specific pen adapter. Implementing classes need to instantiate concrete implementations of the IPenAdapter interface and guarantee that these adapters connect to the appropriate pen instances. Normally, a pen driver will use an injected pen adapter factory to instantiate new pen adapters as needed. This injection is carried out by the surrounding framework, namely a pen driver management component.

Version:
0.0.1
Author:
felix_h

Method Summary
 IPenAdapter create(IPenDriver driver, java.lang.String token)
          This method allows to create a new pen adapter.
 

Method Detail

create

IPenAdapter create(IPenDriver driver,
                   java.lang.String token)
This method allows to create a new pen adapter. Normally, a pen driver will invoke this method in order to create an adapter for a pen. This adapter is then used in order to send samples obtained by the pen.

Parameters of this method are used by the factory to create a unique pen id for each pen. The contract for this id guarantees that each pen obtains the same unique id each time it is connected, as long as the same driver class and the same token are passed upon adapter creation.

Parameters:
driver - the driver requiring creation of the pen adapter
token - a token associated with the adapted pen
Returns:
the created pen adapter
